metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7738 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
In util-linux before 2.32-rc1, bash-completion/umount allows local users to gain privileges by embedding shell commands in a mountpoint name, which is mishandled during a umount command (within Bash) by a different user, as demonstrated by logging in as root and entering umount followed by a tab character for autocompletion.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

fdisk - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
mount - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> bash completion for umount moved from bash-completion to util-linux in util-linux 2.28-1 mdeslaur> script in xenial bash-completion package isn't vulnerable bash-completion package in bionic+ doesn't contain the umount helper

criterions.comment: util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
